policy.title: Sexual Health And HIV/AIDS Prevention Instruction

regulation.title: Sexual Health And HIV/AIDS Prevention Instruction

issues.title: Missing Passive Consent Notification Requirements
issues.description: The policy requires parents to "opt-out" their children but fails to include the mandatory passive consent notification language that must be provided to parents. The notification must explicitly state that if no response is received, the student will participate in the instruction.

legal_citations.text: A pupil may not attend any class in comprehensive sexual health education or HIV/AIDS prevention education, or participate in any anonymous, voluntary, and confidential test, questionnaire, or survey on pupil health behaviors and risks, if the pupil's parent or guardian submits a written request that the pupil not attend the class or participate in the test, questionnaire, or survey.

issues.required_language: The notification shall clearly state that if no written request to excuse the student is received, the student will participate in the comprehensive sexual health education and HIV/AIDS prevention instruction.

issues.title: Missing Curriculum Content Requirements for Grades K-6
issues.description: The regulation only addresses curriculum requirements for grade 7 and above, but Education Code requires specific content standards for comprehensive sexual health education in all grades, including age-appropriate instruction in elementary grades.

legal_citations.text: Comprehensive sexual health education may be provided in kindergarten through grade 12. If a school district elects to offer comprehensive sexual health education in kindergarten through grade 6, whether taught by school district personnel or outside consultants, the instruction and materials shall satisfy the criteria specified in subdivision (a) of Section 51933.

issues.required_language: If comprehensive sexual health education is provided in grades K-6, instruction and materials shall meet all criteria specified in Education Code 51933(a), including age-appropriate content that encourages communication with parents/guardians and teaches respect for marriage and committed relationships.

issues.title: Missing Affirmative Consent Education Requirement
issues.description: The regulation fails to include the mandatory requirement to provide instruction on affirmative consent as part of sexual health education for grades 7-12.

legal_citations.text: Beginning in grade 7, instruction and materials shall provide information about affirmative consent and sexual assault, including the definition of affirmative consent.

issues.required_language: Beginning in grade 7, instruction and materials shall provide information about affirmative consent and sexual assault, including the definition of affirmative consent as ongoing agreement to participate in a sexual activity that can be revoked at any time.

issues.title: Missing School Health Advisory Committee Requirements
issues.description: While the policy mentions an advisory committee may be appointed, it fails to include the mandatory requirements for school health advisory committees when comprehensive sexual health education is provided.

legal_citations.text: A school district that elects to offer comprehensive sexual health education shall ensure that all pupils in grades 7 to 12, inclusive, receive comprehensive sexual health education at least once in junior high or middle school and at least once in high school.

issues.required_language: The district shall establish a school health advisory committee that includes parents, community members, and school personnel to review and recommend comprehensive sexual health education curricula and materials.

issues.title: Outdated Legal References
issues.description: The policy references Education Code sections 51933-51934 for guest speakers, but current law requires reference to sections 51930-51939 for comprehensive information about parent rights.

legal_citations.text: The notice shall include information stating the right of the parent or guardian to request a copy of this chapter.

issues.required_language: Information stating the right of the parent/guardian to request a copy of Education Code sections 51930-51939.
